post.description: This is a primary endpoint which is used to create a new agreement. An agreement can be created using transientDocument, libraryDocument or a URL. You can create an agreement in one of the 3 mentioned states: a) DRAFT - to incrementally build the agreement before sending out, b) AUTHORING - to add/edit form fields in the agreement, c) IN_PROCESS - to immediately send the agreement. You can use the PUT /agreements/{agreementId}/state endpoint to transition an agreement between the above mentioned states. An allowed transition would follow the following sequence: DRAFT -> AUTHORING -> IN_PROCESS -> CANCELLED.

requestBody.description: Information about the agreement that you want to create.

post.summary: Creates an agreement. Sends it out for signatures, and returns the agreementID in the response to the client.

ReminderInfo.description: The information about a reminder associated with a recipient of an agreement.

email.description: The email address of the user

fullName.description: Full name of this account sharer.

permissions.description: A list of permissions given for this account sharing.

userId.description: A unique identifier of the user resource for REST APIs as issued by Acrobat Sign.

comment.description: An optional comment describing to the recipients why you want to cancel the transaction

notifyOthers.description: Whether or not you would like the recipients to be notified that the transaction has been cancelled. The default value is false

email.description: Email of the CC participant of the agreement

label.description: Label of the CC list as returned in workflow description

visiblePages.description:
When you enable limited document visibility (documentVisibilityEnabled), you can specify which file (fileInfo) should be made visible to which specific participant set.
Specify one or more label values of a fileInfos element.
Each signer participant sets must contain at least one required signature field in at least one visible file included in this API call; if not a page with a signature field is automatically appended for any missing participant sets. If there is a possibility that one or more participant sets do not have a required signature field in the files included in the API call, all signer participant sets should include a special index value of '0' to make this automatically appended signature page visible to the signer. Not doing so may result in an error. For all other roles, you may omit this value to exclude this page.

ccs.description: A list of one or more CCs that will be copied in the agreement transaction. The CCs will each receive an email at the beginning of the transaction and also when the final document is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

createdDate.description: Date when agreement was created. This is a server generated attributed and can not be provided in POST/PUT calls. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

deviceInfo.description: Device info of the offline device. It should only be provided in case of offline agreement creation.

documentRetentionAppliedDate.description: Document retention applied date for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

documentVisibilityEnabled.description: If set to true, enable limited document visibility. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

emailOption.description: Email configurations for the agreement. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation or when updating a non draft agreement.

expirationTime.description: Time after which Agreement expires and needs to be signed before it. Format should be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation. Note: the externalId value is visible to all participants through the API, so should not be used to contain a sensitive token.

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be sent out for signature. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined into one PDF before being sent out. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

firstReminderDelay.description:
Integer which specifies the delay in hours before sending the first reminder.
This is an optional field. The minimum value allowed is 1 hour and the maximum value cant be more than the difference of agreement creation and expiry time of the agreement in hours.
If this is not specified but the reminder frequency is specified, then the first reminder will be sent based on frequency.
i.e. if the reminder is created with frequency specified as daily, the firstReminderDelay will be 24 hours. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

formFieldGenerators.description: List of form field generators to produce form fields on the resulting agreement

formFieldLayerTemplates.description: Specifies the form field layer template or source of form fields to apply on the files in this transaction. If specified, the FileInfo for this parameter must refer to a form field layer template via libraryDocumentId or libraryDocumentName, or if specified via transientDocumentId or documentURL, it must be of a supported file type. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

groupId.description: The unique identifier of the group to which the agreement belongs to. If not provided during agreement creation, primary group of the creator will be used

hasFormFieldData.description: True if form field data is present.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

hasSignerIdentityReport.description: True if agreement has signer identity report available.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

id.description: The unique identifier of the agreement.If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

isDocumentRetentionApplied.description: Is document retention applied for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

lastEventDate.description: The date of the last event that occurred for this agreement. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the agreement sender

mergeFieldInfo.description: Optional default values for fields to merge into the document. The values will be presented to the signers for editable fields; for read-only fields the provided values will not be editable during the signing process.

message.description: An optional message to the participants, describing what is being sent or why their signature is required

name.description: The name of the agreement that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

parentId.description: The parent id of a bulk send child *OR* the originating id of a web form agreement instance

participantSetsInfo.description: A list of one or more participant set. A participant set may have one or more participant. If any member of the participant set takes the action that has been assigned to the set(Sign/Approve/Acknowledge etc), the action is considered as the action taken by whole participation set. For regular (non-Send in Bulk) documents, there is no limit on the number of electronic signatures in a single document. Written signatures are limited to four per document

postSignOption.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the user will be taken to after completing the signing process. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

reminderFrequency.description: Optional parameter that sets how often you want to send reminders to the participants. If it is not specified, the default frequency set for the account will be used. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation. If provided in PUT as a different value than the current one, an error will be thrown.

securityOption.description: Optional secondary security parameters for the agreement. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

sendType.description:
Indicates the experience being used by the originator to send an agreement.
FILL_SIGN: originator is using Fill and Sign experience
SELF_SIGN: originator is using Self Signing experience
REGULAR_SEND: originator is using regular Send experience

senderEmail.description: Email of agreement sender. Only provided in GET. Can not be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST/PUT, it will be ignored

signatureType.description:
Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature. The possible values are
ESIGN : Agreement needs to be signed electronically
, WRITTEN : Agreement will be signed using handwritten signature and signed document will be uploaded into the system

state.description: The state in which the agreement should land. The state field can only be provided in POST calls, will never get returned in GET /agreements/{ID} and will be ignored if provided in PUT /agreements/{ID} call. The eventual status of the agreement can be obtained from GET /agreements/ID

status.description: This is a server generated attribute which provides the detailed status of an agreement.

vaultingInfo.description: Vaulting properties that allows Acrobat Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

workflowId.description: The identifier of custom workflow which defines the routing path of an agreement. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

AgreementCreationResponse.description: A JSON  that contains both the id of the newly created agreement and URL / embedded code to direct the user to tne next step in the creation process.

id.description: The unique identifier of the agreement

documentImageUrlsList.description: A list of documents image URLs.

actingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that created the event

actingUserIpAddress.description: The IP address of the user that created the event

actingUserName.description: The name of the acting user

comment.description: The event comment. For RECALLED or REJECTED, the reason given by the user that initiates the event. For DELEGATE or SHARE, the message from the acting user to the participant

date.description: The date of the audit event. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

description.description: A description of the audit event

device.description: The device used for the event.

deviceLocation.description: Location of the device that generated the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

devicePhoneNumber.description: Phone number from the device used when the participation is completed on a mobile phone

digitalSignatureInfo.description: This is present for ESIGNED events when the participation is signed digitally

electronicSealInfo.description: This is present for ELECTRONICLY_SIGNED events when the participation places an electronic seal on the agreement.

initiatingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event on behalf of the acting user when the account is shared. Will be empty if there is no account sharing in effect

initiatingUserName.description: Full name of the user that initiated the event on behalf of the acting user when the account is shared. Will be empty if there is no account sharing in effect

participantEmail.description: Email address of the user that is the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

participantRole.description: Role assumed by all participants in the participant set the participant belongs to (signer, approver etc.).

reminderParticipants.description: A list of one or more participants who received the reminders

replacedParticipantEmail.description: Email of the user that was replaced by the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

replacedParticipantName.description: Full name of the user that was replaced by the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

signerNewName.description: Signer changed name at signing : new name used to sign.

signerOldName.description: Signer changed name at signing : name used previous to signing.

signingReason.description: Signing reason captured during ESIGN or DIGSIGN

synchronizationId.description: A unique identifier linking offline events to synchronization events (specified for offline signing events and synchronization events, else null)

vaultEventId.description: The identifier assigned by the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

vaultProviderName.description: Name of the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

versionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the version of the document associated with this audit event

Should not be provided in offline agreement creation. If provided in PUT as a different value than the current one, an error will be thrown.

securityOption.description: Optional secondary security parameters for the agreement. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

sendType.description:
Indicates the experience being used by the originator to send an agreement.
FILL_SIGN: originator is using Fill and Sign experience
SELF_SIGN: originator is using Self Signing experience
REGULAR_SEND: originator is using regular Send experience

senderEmail.description: Email of agreement sender. Only provided in GET. Can not be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST/PUT, it will be ignored

signatureType.description:
Specifies the type of signature you would like to request - written or e-signature. The possible values are
ESIGN : Agreement needs to be signed electronically
, WRITTEN : Agreement will be signed using handwritten signature and signed document will be uploaded into the system

state.description: The state in which the agreement should land. The state field can only be provided in POST calls, will never get returned in GET /agreements/{ID} and will be ignored if provided in PUT /agreements/{ID} call. The eventual status of the agreement can be obtained from GET /agreements/ID

status.description: This is a server generated attribute which provides the detailed status of an agreement.

workflowId.description: The identifier of custom workflow which defines the routing path of an agreement. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

comment.description: Comment describing the reason to reject this agreement.

message.description: Message explaining the reason for the agreement restart

canEditAgreementSettings.description: if false, the user will not be allowed to modify any agreement settings. defaults to true.

canEditElectronicSeals.description: if false, the user will not be allowed to modify electronic seal, defaults to true.

canEditFiles.description: if false, the user will not be permitted to modify the set of files being sent out for signature, defaults to true.

hipaaEnabled.description: True if the Agreement sender had HIPAA protections enabled for their agreements at the time the agreement was created.

state.description: The state in which the agreement should land

embeddedCode.description: Embedded code of url of resource

isCurrent.description: True if this view is the current view

name.description: Name of the requested agreement view

autoLoginUser.description: Auto LogIn Flag. If true, the URL returned will automatically log the user in. If false, the URL returned will require the credentials. By default its value is false

frameParent.description: An optional field to provide the comma-separated list of parent domain urls where the returned URLs may be iframed. If provided with non-empty and valid list of parent domain urls, it will be used to allow framing for the same. By default the value is null and the Acrobat Sign pages will not be viewable in an iframe.

noChrome.description: No Chrome Flag. If true, the embedded page is shown without a navigation header or footer. If false, the standard page header and footer will be present. By default its value is false

postSendOption.description: Optional field available only in COMPOSE, AUTHORING and PREFILL views or as part of ALL view. Allows API client to configure a URL to redirect the sender to after the SEND flow is complete. User must be logged in or autoLoginUser=true must be specified to configure the redirect. The view URL returned in the API response must be visited within 60 seconds of the response to configure the redirect. If not the user will be redirected to the default POST_SEND view

commonViewConfiguration.description: Common view configuration for all the available views

name.description: Name of the requested agreement view

anchorText.description: Text to search for to generate form fields relative to

anchoredFormFieldLocation.description: Information on the relative location to generate form fields

pages.description: An array of page numbers to search for anchored text to generate form fields on. By default all pages will be searched

AnchoredFormFieldLocation.description: Location information for placing generated form fields relative to the location of text content found within the agreement documents

width.description: The generated form field width in default user space units

company.description: Company of the CC participant, if available.

email.description: Email of the CC participant of the agreement

self.description: True if the CC participant is the same user that is calling the API.

documentPagesInfo.description: List of basic information of all pages of the combined document of an Agreement.

fileUploadOptions.description: Controls various file upload options available on the compose page

isPreviewSelected.description: Should the compose page be provided with authoring mode selected?

email.description: Email of the participant. In case of modifying a participant set (PUT) this is a required field. In case of GET, this is the required field and will always be returned unless it is a fax workflow (legacy agreements) that were created using fax as input

fullName.description: The full name of the delegatee, if available.

securityOption.description: Security options that apply to the participant.

phoneInfo.description: The phoneInfo required for the participant to view and sign the document

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant-specific data (e.g. email). All participants in the array belong to the same set. Required, unless ParticipantSet has the ELECTRONIC_SEALER role

privateMessage.description: Participant set's private message - all participants in the set will receive the same message. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

DelegationResponse.description: A JSON that contains the id of newly created delegated participant set

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant set to which the agreement was forwarded.

company.description: The company of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

createdDate.description: The date when the participant was added. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: Email of the participant. In case of modifying a participant set (PUT) this is a required field. In case of GET, this is the required field and will always be returned unless it is a fax workflow (legacy agreements) that were created using fax as input

hidden.description: True if the agreement is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true. Ignored (not required) if modifying a participant (PUT).

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant. This will be returned as part of Get call but is not mandatory to be passed as part of PUT call for agreements/{id}/members/participantSets/{id}.

name.description: The name of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

privateMessage.description: The private message of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

securityOption.description: Security options that apply to the participant.

self.description: True if this participant is the same user that is calling the API. Returned as part of Get. Ignored (not required) if modifying a participant set (PUT).

status.description: The status of the participant. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call. New participants will be ignored if added with a REPLACED status.

userId.description: The user ID of the participant. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

electronicSealId.description: ID of the sealing credential, which can be obtained through GET /autoseals call.

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant set. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant-specific data (e.g. email). All participants in the array belong to the same set. Required, unless ParticipantSet has the ELECTRONIC_SEALER role

name.description: Name of ParticipantSet (it can be empty, but needs not to be unique in a single agreement). Maximum no of characters in participant set name is restricted to 255. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

order.description: Index indicating sequential signing group (specified for hybrid routing). This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

privateMessage.description: Participant set's private message - all participants in the set will receive the same message. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver etc.). This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

status.description: The agreement status with respect to the participant set. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

providerDesc.description: Digital Identity Gateway Provider Description. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls.

cloudProviderUrl.description: Cloud Provider URL for digital signing

createdDate.description: The date the document was created

mimeType.description: mimeType of the original file. This is returned in GET but not accepted back in PUT

name.description: Name of the original document uploaded. This is returned in GET but not accepted back in PUT

numPages.description: Number of pages in the document

imageSize.description: ImageSize corresponding to the imageUrl returned

imagesAvailable.description: true if images for the associated image size is available, else false.

documentImageUrlsList.description: A list of documents image URLs.

rotation.description: Rotation angle of the page in clockwise direction in degree

originalDocumentsImageUrlsInfo.description: A list of original document image URLs info.

supportingDocumentsImageUrlsInfo.description: A list of supporting document image URLs info.

company.description: Company name that placed the electronic seal

id.description: unique identifier for the electronic seal

name.description: the display name of the electronic seal

sendOptions.description: Specify emails to be sent to different participants at different steps of the agreement process. Note: ALL means  emails for the events will be sent to all participants. NONE means emails for the events will not be sent to any participant

id.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried. Note: the externalId value is visible to all participants through the API, so should not be used to contain a sensitive token.

ccs.description: A list of one or more CCs that will be copied in the agreement transaction. The CCs will each receive an email at the beginning of the transaction and also when the final document is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

createdDate.description: Date when agreement was created. This is a server generated attributed and can not be provided in POST/PUT calls. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

deviceInfo.description: Device info of the offline device. It should only be provided in case of offline agreement creation.

documentRetentionAppliedDate.description: Document retention applied date for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

documentVisibilityEnabled.description: If set to true, enable limited document visibility. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

emailOption.description: Email configurations for the agreement. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation or when updating a non draft agreement.

expirationTime.description: Time after which Agreement expires and needs to be signed before it. Format should be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

externalId.description: An arbitrary value from your system, which can be specified at sending time and then later returned or queried. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation. Note: the externalId value is visible to all participants through the API, so should not be used to contain a sensitive token.

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be sent out for signature. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined into one PDF before being sent out. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

firstReminderDelay.description:
Integer which specifies the delay in hours before sending the first reminder.
This is an optional field. The minimum value allowed is 1 hour and the maximum value cant be more than the difference of agreement creation and expiry time of the agreement in hours.
If this is not specified but the reminder frequency is specified, then the first reminder will be sent based on frequency.
i.e. if the reminder is created with frequency specified as daily, the firstReminderDelay will be 24 hours. Should not be provided in offline agreement creation.

formFieldGenerators.description: List of form field generators to produce form fields on the resulting agreement

formFieldLayerTemplates.description: Specifies the form field layer template or source of form fields to apply on the files in this transaction. If specified, the FileInfo for this parameter must refer to a form field layer template via libraryDocumentId or libraryDocumentName, or if specified via transientDocumentId or documentURL, it must be of a supported file type. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

groupId.description: The unique identifier of the group to which the agreement belongs to. If not provided during agreement creation, primary group of the creator will be used

hasFormFieldData.description: True if form field data is present.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

hasSignerIdentityReport.description: True if agreement has signer identity report available.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

id.description: The unique identifier of the agreement.If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

isDocumentRetentionApplied.description: Is document retention applied for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

lastEventDate.description: The date of the last event that occurred for this agreement. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

locale.description: The locale associated with this agreement - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the agreement sender

mergeFieldInfo.description: Optional default values for fields to merge into the document. The values will be presented to the signers for editable fields; for read-only fields the provided values will not be editable during the signing process.

message.description: An optional message to the participants, describing what is being sent or why their signature is required

name.description: The name of the agreement that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

parentId.description: The parent id of a bulk send child *OR* the originating id of a web form agreement instance

participantSetsInfo.description: A list of one or more participant set. A participant set may have one or more participant. If any member of the participant set takes the action that has been assigned to the set(Sign/Approve/Acknowledge etc), the action is considered as the action taken by whole participation set. For regular (non-Send in Bulk) documents, there is no limit on the number of electronic signatures in a single document. Written signatures are limited to four per document

libraryDocument.description: Whether library documents link should appear or not. Default value is taken as true

webConnectors.description: Whether link to attach documents from web sources like Dropbox should appear or not. Default value is taken as true

FormField.description: A form field for an agreement.

assignee.description: Who the field is assigned to. Valid values are a participant set id, null, "NOBODY", "PREFILL" or "EVERYONE". If set to a participant set id, then any member of that participant set may fill out the field. "NOBODY" indicates that the field may not be filled by anybody (e.g. autopopulated fields like transaction number). "PREFILL" indicates that the field will be filled by the sender before the agreement is sent out for signing. "EVERYONE" exists only in hyperlink fields currently and indicates that it is assigned to all participants. null indicates that anybody may fill out the field. If the propeerty isn't specified, it is treated as null.

NotaryInfo.description: Additional information for agreements that require notarization

appointment.description: A proposed appointment time specified using the yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ format.

notaryEmail.description: Email address of provided notary when the notaryType is BYON_NOTARY

notaryType.description:
PROVIDER_NOTARY: Notary is provided by the notary provider
BYON_NOTARY: In house Notary is provided by the customer

payment.description:
BY_SENDER: When the notarization provider provides the notary and the notary fee will be paid by the sender
BY_SIGNER: When the notarization provider provides the notary and the notary fee will be paid by the signer

deviceTime.description: The device local time. The device time provided should not be before 30 days of current date.Format should be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time, while 2016-02-25T13:46:19-05:00 represents the same time in EST

nextCursor.description: Used to navigate to the next page. If notreturned, there are no further pages.

authenticationMethod.description: The authentication method for the participants to have access to view and sign the document. When replacing a participant that has PASSWORD or PHONE authentication specified, you must supply a password or phone number for the new participant, and you cannot change the authentication method

notaryAuthentication.description: The authentication method of the notary participant to the notary

password.description: The password required for the participant to view and sign the document. Note that Acrobat Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. The password will not be returned in GET call. When replacing a participant that has PASSWORD authentication specified, you must supply a password for the new participant.

phoneInfo.description: The phoneInfo required for the participant to view and sign the document

electronicSealId.description: ID of the sealing credential, which can be obtained through GET /autoseals call.

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls. The Id might be null in draft state

label.description:
The unique label of a participant set.
For custom workflows, label specified in the participation set should map it to the participation step in the custom workflow.

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant-specific data (e.g. email). All participants in the array belong to the same set. Required, unless ParticipantSet has the ELECTRONIC_SEALER role

name.description: Name of the participant set (it can be empty, but if present it must be unique within a single agreement). Maximum no of characters in participant set name is restricted to 255

order.description: Index indicating position at which signing group needs to sign. Signing group to sign at first place is assigned a 1 index. Different signingOrder specified in input should form a valid consecutive increasing sequence of integers. Otherwise signingOrder will be considered invalid.

privateMessage.description: Participant set's private message - all participants in the set will receive the same message

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver etc.)

visiblePages.description:
When you enable limited document visibility (documentVisibilityEnabled), you can specify which file (fileInfo) should be made visible to which specific participant set.
Specify one or more label values of a fileInfos element.
Each signer participant sets must contain at least one required signature field in at least one visible file included in this API call; if not a page with a signature field is automatically appended for any missing participant sets. If there is a possibility that one or more participant sets do not have a required signature field in the files included in the API call, all signer participant sets should include a special index value of '0' to make this automatically appended signature page visible to the signer. Not doing so may result in an error. For all other roles, you may omit this value to exclude this page.

email.description: Email of the participant. In case of creating new Agreements(POST/PUT), this is a required field.

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls. The Id might be null in draft state

securityOption.description: Security options that apply to the participant

countryCode.description: The numeric country calling code (ISD code) required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication type is PHONE

countryIsoCode.description: The country ISO Alpha-2 code required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication method is PHONE

phone.description: The phone number required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication method is PHONE. When replacing a participant that has PHONE authentication specified, you must supply a phone number for the new participant.

redirectUrl.description: URL to redirect to after completion of the SEND flow. Specified URL must be part of the allow list for application redirects, configured by a CSR Admin

redirectDelay.description: The delay (in seconds) before the user is taken to the success page. If this value is greater than 0, the user will first see the standard Acrobat Sign success message, and then after a delay will be redirected to your success page

redirectUrl.description: A publicly accessible url to which the user will be sent after successfully completing the signing process

id.description: An identifier of the reminder resource created on the server. If provided in POST or PUT, it will be ignored

firstReminderDelay.description:
Integer which specifies the delay in hours before sending the first reminder.
This is an optional field. The minimum value allowed is 1 hour and the maximum value cant be more than the difference of agreement creation and expiry time of the agreement in hours.
If this is not specified but the reminder frequency is specified, then the first reminder will be sent based on frequency.
i.e. if the reminder is created with frequency specified as daily, the firstReminderDelay will be 24 hours. Cannot be updated in a PUT

frequency.description:
The frequency at which reminder will be sent until the agreement is completed.
If frequency is not provided, the reminder will be sent once (if the agreement is available at the specified time) with the delay based on the firstReminderDelay field and will never repeat again. If the agreement is not available at that time, reminder will not be sent. Cannot be updated in a PUT

lastSentDate.description: The date when the reminder was last sent. Only provided in GET. Cannot be provided in POST request. If provided in POST, it will be ignored. Cannot be updated in a PUT. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

nextSentDate.description: The date when the reminder is scheduled to be sent next. When provided in POST request, frequency needs to be ONCE (or not specified), startReminderCounterFrom needs to be REMINDER_CREATION (or not specified) and firstReminderDelay needs to be 0 (or not specified). Cannot be updated in a PUT. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

note.description: An optional message sent to the recipients, describing why their participation is required

recipientParticipantIds.description: A list of one or more participant IDs that the reminder should be sent to. These must be recipients of the agreement and not sharees or cc's.

reminderId.description: An identifier of the reminder resource created on the server. If provided in POST or PUT, it will be ignored

startReminderCounterFrom.description:
Reminder can be sent based on when the agreement becomes available or when the reminder is created
AGREEMENT_AVAILABILITY: If the agreement is not available to the participant at the time of reminder creation, the reminder will be sent for the first time, only when the agreement becomes available to the participant taking the firstReminderDelay into account. Subsequent reminders will be sent based on the frequency specified. If the agreement is already available to the participant at the time of reminder creation, the first reminder will be sent after the delay specified by firstReminderDelay from the reminder creation time.
REMINDER_CREATION: The first reminder will be sent after the delay specified by firstReminderDelay from the reminder creation time only if the agreement is available at that time. Subsequent reminders will be triggered based on the frequency specified and will be sent only if the agreement is available at that time. For agreements in authoring state, creating reminder with startReminderCounterFrom as REMINDER_CREATION is not allowed.
Note : If firstReminderDelay, frequency and startReminderCounterFrom fields are not specified in POST, reminder will be sent right now if the agreement is available. If agreement is not available, an error will be thrown. Cannot be updated in a PUT

status.description: Current status of the reminder.  The only valid update in a PUT is from ACTIVE to CANCELED.  Must be provided as ACTIVE in a POST.

email.description: The email address of the participant

name.description: The full name of the participant

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant

reminderInfoList.description: A list of one or more reminders created on the agreement specified by the unique identifier agreementId by the user invoking the API.

openPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to secure the PDF document. Note that Acrobat Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties

completionEmails.description: Control notification mails for agreement completion events - COMPLETED, CANCELLED, EXPIRED and REJECTED

inFlightEmails.description: Control notification mails for agreement-in-process events - DELEGATED, REPLACED

initEmails.description: Control notification mails for Agreement initiation events - ACTION_REQUESTED and CREATED

company.description: Company of the sender, if available.

createdDate.description: The date when the sender was added. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: Email of the sender of the agreement.

hidden.description: True if the agreement is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

name.description: Name of the sender, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the sender of the agreement.

self.description: True if the sender is the same user that is calling the API.

status.description: The agreement status with respect to the participant set. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

userId.description: The user ID of the sender. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: The email address of the member with whom the agreement will be shared
The email address that was requested

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant

hidden.description: True if the agreement is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

name.description: Name of the sharee participant, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the sharee participant of the agreement.

self.description: True if the Share participant is the same user that is calling the API.

securityOption.description: Optional secondary security parameters for the signer identity report.

email.description: The email address of the signer associated with this signing url

esignUrl.description: The email address of the signer associated with this signing url

signingUrlSetInfos.description: An array of urls for signer sets involved in this agreement.

signingUrlSetName.description: The name of the current signer set. Returned only, if the API caller is the sender of agreement

signingUrls.description: An array of urls for current signer set.

fieldName.description: The name of the supporting document field

numPages.description: Number of pages in the document

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant that uploaded the supporting document

mimeType.description: The mime type of the referenced file, used to determine if the file can be accepted and the necessary conversion steps can be performed

name.description: The original system file name of the document being sent

url.description: A publicly accessible URL for retrieving the raw file content

displayDate.description: The display date for the agreement. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

displayParticipantSetInfos.description: The most relevant current user set for the agreement. It is typically the next signer if the agreement is from the current user, or the sender if received from another user

esign.description: True if this is an e-sign document

hidden.description: True if agreement is hidden for the user

id.description: The unique identifier of the agreement.If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

latestVersionId.description: A version ID which uniquely identifies the current version of the agreement

parentId.description: The parent id of a bulk send child *OR* the originating id of a web form agreement instance

status.description: This is a server generated attribute which provides the detailed status of an agreement with respect to the apiCaller

page.description: Pagination information for navigating through the response

vaultEventComment.description: The description provided by the vault provider for the vault event

vaultEventId.description: The identifier assigned by the vault provider for the vault event

enabled.description: For accounts set up for document vaulting and the option to enable per agreement, this determines whether the document is to be vaulted

visibility.description: Specifies the visibility. The possible values are HIDE or SHOW
